title: Double click on chat element in the list required to switch to another chat if I sent a message before
body:
***Type***: Bug

***Summary***:  Chat list views require double clicks in order to select particular chat (the first click apparently moves the view onfocus - so next clicks are actionable and select a chat element). It happens if the view was unfocused before by click, for example on 'Send message' button or switching from profile view to Home view. Please see video (view clicks) recorded and scenarios below for when and where it happens.
This issue is on Desktop builds

#### Expected behavior
Click upon particular chat element opens chat view disregard previous activities in Status app

#### Actual behavior
User have to click twice upon chat element to open different chat view after sending message 
Please see video: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nrfrkMVAhBF4IElj5A4t9eu4XQV5UX17/view

### Preconditions for below scenarios
- Open Status
- Join 2 or more public chats
- Add any user in the contact list

### Steps to reproduce (1)
1) Switch to Profile view
2) Switch to Home view.
3) Click any chat element from left chat list panel
**Actual result:** Nothing happens
4) Click one more time on ANY chat item from the list.
**Actual result = Expected result:** Chat view opened.

### Steps to reproduce (2)
1) Switch to Home view
2) Click ‘+’(add new chat) button -> `Join public chat`
3) Click any element from the default public chats items on the list.
**Actual result:** Nothing happens
4) But, click one more time on ANY chat item from the list.
**Actual result = Expected result**: Chat view opened.

### Steps to reproduce (3)
1) Switch to Home view
2) Select any chat
3) Type text message
4) Click ‘Send message’ button
5) Click any chat element from left chat list panel
**Actual result:** Nothing happens
6) But, click one more time on ANY chat item from the list.
**Actual result = Expected result:** Chat view opened.
**NOTE**: it’s all fine in 3rd scenario if to skip its 4th step


### Additional Information
* Status version: Develop `v0.9.0 (2fd3ff798)`
* Operating System: MacOS Mojave 10.14.3
